cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a context-aware keyword spotting model employing a character-level recurrent neural network (RNN) for spoken term detection in continuous speech. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including: 

- cs.SD (Sound): This sub-category deals with research related to sound and audio processing, which is directly relevant to the proposed keyword spotting model in this paper. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category deals with research related to natural language processing, which is also relevant to the proposed model since it involves detecting keywords in spoken language. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with research related to machine learning, which is the underlying technology used in the proposed model. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): This sub-category deals with research related to artificial intelligence, which is also relevant to the proposed model since it involves using machine learning to detect keywords in spoken language. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): This sub-category deals with research related to computer vision and pattern recognition, which may be less relevant but could potentially be related to the visual representation of spoken language.
